items.title: OPINION | India’s E-commerce Surge: A market multiplier for startups and investors
items.description: The question is no longer whether Indians will shop online, but how deeply digital commerce will reshape the nation’s economy, jobs, and competitiveness. The evidence is clear: e-commerce has moved from convenience to core, from optional to inevitable – the very backbone of India’s growth story this decade

items.title: Trent mirrors Westside’s store model online, says no to flash sales
items.description: Around 5–6% of Westside’s sales now come from digital channels, which the company says is significant. The online store matches physical outlets in both pricing and product selection, making e-commerce an extension of the brand

items.title: India's M&A and demerger is still stuck in the old mould
items.description: M&A and succession planning are not technical footnotes; they are central to India’s corporate growth story. Unless the tax regime adapts to commercial reality, the promise of the new Act will remain only on paper.

items.title: Vodafone Idea's share rise 6 percent as plea against DoT's AGR demand tentatively listed for hearing on September 19
items.description: The telecom firm had moved the Supreme Court seeking to quash the additional demand of AGR dues worth Rs 9,450 crore by the DoT, and argued that the demand exceeds the scope of the Court’s earlier ruling on AGR liabilities.

items.title: Apeejay Surrendra Park Hotels: Why this hotel stock merits attention
items.description: Apeejay Surrendra Park Hotels is pressing the growth pedal by taking hotels on leases, acquiring some, and scaling up the Flurys bakery and confectionaries business

items.title: SpiceJet delaying salary payments to sizable number of employees: Report
items.description: SpiceJet employees drawing a salary of up to Rs 55,000 per month have received payment for August, while the rest of the staff has not been paid yet.

items.title: Besides JV route, NTPC looking to set up nuclear projects on standalone basis: CMD Gurdeep Singh
items.description: The company is collaborating with technology providers and state governments to explore individual nuclear projects, Singh said

items.title: Excited about India both as market, tech hub: Publicis Sapient Global CEO Nigel Vaz
items.description: Publicis Sapient is the digital business transformation hub of one of world’s largest advertising companies, Publicis Groupe, and has 20,000 people across 72 offices globally.
